member.name: T:UsefulThings.Extensions
member.summary: Extension methods for various things, both WPF and WinForms

member.name: M:UsefulThings.Extensions.#cctor
member.summary: Static constructor.

member.name: M:UsefulThings.Extensions.InvokeIfRequired(System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher,System.Action,System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority)
member.summary: A simple WPF threading extension method, to invoke a delegate on the correct thread if it is not currently on the correct thread Which can be used with DispatcherObject types
member.param: The Dispatcher object on which to do the Invoke

member.name: M:UsefulThings.Extensions.ReadStreamFully(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
member.summary:
KFreon: Borrowed this from the DevIL C# Wrapper found here: https://code.google.com/p/devil-net/
Reads a stream until the end is reached into a byte array. Based on Jon Skeet's implementation. It is up to the caller to dispose of the stream.
member.param: Stream to read all bytes from
member.returns: The byte array containing all the bytes from the stream

member.name: M:UsefulThings.Extensions.Contains``1(System.Collections.Generic.List{``0},System.Predicate{``0})
member.summary: Checks if anything matches given predicate in List. e.g. Check if text files in list: predicate = t => t.EndsWith(".txt")
member.param: Predicate to determine if item is in list.
member.returns: True if item found in List.

member.name: M:UsefulThings.Extensions.Contains``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Predicate{``0})
member.summary: Checks if anything matches given predicate in enumerable. e.g. Check if text files in list: predicate = t => t.EndsWith(".txt")

member.summary: Add range of elements to given collection.

member.summary: Removes element from collection at index.

member.summary: Converts enumerable to List in a more memory efficient way by providing size of list.

member.summary: Converts enumerable to array in a more memory efficient way by providing size of list.

member.name: M:UsefulThings.Extensions.BeginAdjustableAnimation(System.Windows.ContentElement,System.Windows.DependencyProperty,UsefulThings.WPF.GridLengthAnimation,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an animation that automatically sets final value to be held. Used with FillType.Stop rather than default FillType.Hold.
member.param: Property of element to animate using anim.

member.name: M:UsefulThings.Extensions.BeginAdjustableAnimation(System.Windows.ContentElement,System.Windows.DependencyProperty,UsefulThings.WPF.GridLengthAnimation)
member.summary: Begins adjustable animation for a GridlengthAnimation. Holds animation end value without Holding it. i.e. Allows it to change after animation without resetting it. Should be possible in WPF...maybe it is.
member.param: Animation to perform. GridLengthAnimation only for now.

member.name: T:UsefulThings.MemoryTributary
member.summary: MemoryTributary is a re-implementation of MemoryStream that uses a dynamic list of byte arrays as a backing store, instead of a single byte array, the allocation of which will fail for relatively small streams as it requires contiguous memory.

member.name: M:UsefulThings.MemoryTributary.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an empty MemoryStream-like instance which doesn't require contiguous memory.

member.name: M:UsefulThings.MemoryTributary.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a MemoryStream-like instance which doesn't require contiguous memory, based on a byte[] source.

member.name: M:UsefulThings.MemoryTributary.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a MemoryStream-like instance which doesn't require contiguous memory, with length (ignored).

member.name: P:UsefulThings.MemoryTributary.block
member.summary: The block of memory currently addressed by Position

member.name: P:UsefulThings.MemoryTributary.blockId
member.summary: The id of the block currently addressed by Position

member.name: P:UsefulThings.MemoryTributary.blockOffset
member.summary: The offset of the byte currently addressed by Position, into the block that contains it

member.name: M:UsefulThings.MemoryTributary.Flush
member.summary: Does nothing for now.

member.name: M:UsefulThings.MemoryTributary.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies bytes from this stream at the current position TO the buffer. Doesn't reset stream position. Returns number of bytes read from stream.
member.param: Offset to begin writing at in buffer>
Number of bytes to read from stream>

member.name: M:UsefulThings.MemoryTributary.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Changes stream position to given offset based on given origin. Returns new stream position.

member.name: M:UsefulThings.MemoryTributary.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes data FROM buffer TO stream at current position. Doesn't reset stream position.
member.param: Offset to begin writing from in buffer.

member.name: M:UsefulThings.MemoryTributary.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads byte from stream at current position and advances stream.

member.name: M:UsefulThings.MemoryTributary.WriteByte(System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes byte to stream at current position and advances stream.

member.name: M:UsefulThings.MemoryTributary.ToArray
member.summary: Returns the entire content of the stream as a byte array. This is not safe because the call to new byte[] may fail if the stream is large enough. Where possible use methods which operate on streams directly instead.
member.returns: A byte[] containing the current data in the stream

member.name: M:UsefulThings.MemoryTributary.ReadFrom(System.IO.Stream,System.Int64)
member.summary: Reads length bytes from source stream into the this instance at the current position.
member.param: The stream containing the data to copy
The number of bytes to copy

member.name: M:UsefulThings.MemoryTributary.WriteTo(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Writes the entire stream into destination, regardless of Position, which remains unchanged.
member.param: The stream to write the content of this stream to

member.summary: Constructor for backbone.
member.param: Function to be run before each job.
Function to be run after each job.

member.summary: Adds job to backbone.
member.param: Job to be added to queue.

member.name: T:UsefulThings.WinForms.Gooey
member.summary: Allows some control over changing the state (enabled/visible) of a set of controls. Features: Exclude controls from state changes. Switch state changes between enabling and changing visibility. A function can replace state changes. e.g. Instead of enabling, set some text or whatever.

member.name: M:UsefulThings.WinForms.Gooey.ChangeState(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Changes state of all listed controls.
member.param: If true, enables/makes visible. Functions run regardless and take state as parameter.

member.name: M:UsefulThings.WinForms.Gooey.AddControl(System.Object,System.String,System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds given control to list of controls to be maintained by this class.
member.param: Control to be added (ToolStripItem or Form Control)
Key to identify control. MUST be a unique part of the Control name.
Effect to be run on state change. Bool or Action.
Optional. If true, this control is affected by state changes.
Optional. If true, property affected by state changes is the Enabled property, otherwise uses the visible property.

member.name: M:UsefulThings.WinForms.Gooey.ModifyControl(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Modifies control specified by key, changes whether control is affected by state changes.
member.param: If true, control is affected by state changes.

member.name: M:UsefulThings.WinForms.Gooey.GetControlAffectedState(System.String)
member.summary: Gets whether control specified by key is affected by state changes.
member.param: Key of control to look for.
member.returns: True if control is affected by state changes, else false.
